findings.lower_chest: Visualized lung fields are within normal limits. There is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.

abdomen.hepatobiliary: The liver demonstrates homogenous attenuation throughout. There is no evidence of focal lesions. No evidence of biliary dilatation. The gallbladder is within normal limits.
abdomen.pancreas: Normal attenuation throughout, without evidence of focal lesions or pancreatic ductal dilatation. No peripancreatic stranding.
abdomen.spleen: Normal size and attenuation throughout, without evidence of focal lesions.
abdomen.urinary: Normal and symmetric size with normal nephrogram. No focal renal lesions or hydronephrosis. No perinephric abnormality.

gastrointestinal.small_bowel: Normal caliber, wall thickness, and enhancement throughout.
gastrointestinal.colon: Extensive colonic diverticulosis with mural thickening and inflamed diverticula noted within proximal transverse colon at the hepatic flexure.

abdomen.pelvis: Urinary bladder and distal ureters are unremarkable. No free fluid in the pelvis.
abdomen.reproductive_organs: Uterus is surgically absent. A complex 3.8 x 2.0 x 3.6 cm cystic structure in the left adnexa is new/increased in size, may represent a left hematosalpinx or an ovarian hemorrhagic cyst.
abdomen.lymph_nodes: No retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy. No pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
abdomen.vascular: No abdominal aortic aneurysm. No noted atherosclerotic disease.
abdomen.bones: No evidence of worrisome osseous lesions or acute fracture.
abdomen.soft_tissues: Abdominal and pelvic wall is within normal limits.

radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Complex cystic structure in the left adnexa is new/increased in size since the MR pelvis.
